tasks.title: Set Up Development, Analyze Codebase, and Establish Testing Environment
tasks.description: Set up the development environment, including necessary tools and configurations. Analyze the existing codebase to understand the current structure and identify key areas for modification. Establish a testing environment to ensure changes do not negatively impact existing functionality.
tasks.details:
1.  **Development Environment Setup:**
    *   Install required dependencies (Node.js, npm/yarn, Next.js).
    *   Configure IDE (VSCode, etc.) with necessary extensions (ESLint, Prettier).
    *   Set up version control (Git) and connect to the project repository.
2.  **Codebase Analysis:**
    *   Explore `frontend/app/books/[id]/page.tsx` to understand the page structure and data flow.
    *   Examine `frontend/components/ts/TSNoteCard.tsx` to understand the existing note card component (but avoid modifying it).
    *   Review `frontend/styles/globals.css` to identify existing styles and potential conflicts.
3.  **Testing Environment Setup:**
    *   Configure a local development server using `npm run dev` or `yarn dev`.
    *   Set up testing tools (Jest, React Testing Library) if not already configured.
    *   Create initial test cases to verify existing functionality.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify the development environment is correctly set up and the existing application runs without errors. Confirm that the testing environment is configured and initial tests pass.

subtasks.title: Set up Development Environment
subtasks.description: Install necessary tools (e.g., IDE, compilers, interpreters) and configure the development environment.
subtasks.details: Specify the required software versions and configuration steps.

subtasks.description: Review the codebase, focusing on specified files to understand their structure, functionality, and dependencies.
subtasks.details:
List the specific files to analyze and the aspects to focus on (e.g., data structures, algorithms).

subtasks.title: Write Initial Tests
subtasks.description: Develop a set of initial tests to verify the functionality of the codebase, focusing on key areas identified during analysis.
subtasks.details: Define the scope of the initial tests and the expected outcomes.

subtasks.title: Document Setup Process
subtasks.description: Create documentation outlining the steps taken to set up the development and testing environments.
subtasks.details: Include detailed instructions, screenshots, and troubleshooting tips.

tasks.title: Improve Book Title Area Visual Emphasis on Mobile
tasks.description: Implement responsive styles for the book title area to enhance visual emphasis on mobile devices. Use background colors and borders to create an outline effect. Ensure the changes are only applied on mobile screens using the `max-sm` prefix.
tasks.details:
1. **Modify `frontend/app/books/[id]/page.tsx`:** * Wrap the book title area with a `div` element. * Apply Tailwind CSS classes conditionally using the `max-sm:` prefix to target mobile screens. * Example: ```jsx

{book.title}

``` 2. **Responsive Application:** * Utilize Tailwind CSS's responsive modifiers (`max-sm:`) to apply styles only on mobile devices. 3. **Testing:** * Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly. * Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the book title area has the correct styling on mobile devices and that the desktop view is unaffected. Test on multiple mobile screen sizes.

tasks.title: Improve Memo Hub Section Outline on Mobile
tasks.description: Improve the outline of the memo hub section by modifying the background and border styles. Apply a more distinct card-like outline and add a shadow effect to enhance depth. Ensure these changes are only applied on mobile screens.
tasks.details:
1. **Modify `frontend/app/books/[id]/page.tsx`:** * Locate the memo hub section. * Wrap the section with a `div` element. * Apply Tailwind CSS classes conditionally using the `max-sm:` prefix to target mobile screens. * Example: ```jsx
{/* Memo Hub Content */}
``` 2. **Outline and Shadow:** * Use Tailwind CSS classes for border, rounded corners, and shadow effects. 3. **Testing:** * Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly. * Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the memo hub section has the correct outline and shadow on mobile devices and that the desktop view is unaffected. Test on multiple mobile screen sizes.

tasks.title: Improve Tab Structure Visuals on Mobile
tasks.description: Apply mobile-optimized styles to the tab buttons. Enhance the visual distinction between active and inactive tabs by improving the border and background colors. Ensure these changes are only applied on mobile screens.
tasks.details:
1.  **Modify `frontend/app/books/[id]/page.tsx`:**
    *   Locate the tab button elements.
    *   Apply Tailwind CSS classes conditionally using the `max-sm:` prefix to target mobile screens.
    *   Example:
        ```jsx
        <button className="max-sm:bg-gray-100 max-sm:text-gray-700 max-sm:border max-sm:border-gray-300 max-sm:rounded-md">
            Tab 1
        </button>
        ```
2.  **Active/Inactive States:**
    *   Use conditional classes to change the appearance of active and inactive tabs.
3.  **Testing:**
    *   Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly.
    *   Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the tab buttons have the correct styling on mobile devices and that the desktop view is unaffected. Test the active/inactive states and multiple mobile screen sizes.

tasks.title: Ensure Overall Visual Consistency on Mobile
tasks.description: Ensure visual consistency across the entire page on mobile devices. Optimize spacing and padding to improve the overall layout. Refine the visual hierarchy to guide the user's eye.
tasks.details:
1. **Modify `frontend/app/books/[id]/page.tsx`:** * Review the entire page layout on mobile. * Adjust padding and margin using Tailwind CSS classes to create a balanced and visually appealing layout. * Example: ```jsx
{/* Content */}
``` 2. **Color Harmony:** * Ensure the color scheme is consistent and visually pleasing on mobile. 3. **Visual Hierarchy:** * Use font sizes, weights, and colors to create a clear visual hierarchy. 4. **Testing:** * Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the layout is consistent. * Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the overall visual consistency is improved on mobile devices and that the desktop view is unaffected. Test on multiple mobile screen sizes.

tasks.title: Test and Verify UI on Mobile Devices
tasks.description: Test the UI on various mobile screen sizes to ensure responsiveness. Verify that existing functionalities, such as tab switching and memo editing, work correctly. Perform cross-browser testing to ensure compatibility across different mobile browsers. Measure the performance impact of the changes.
tasks.details:
1.  **Responsive Testing:**
    *   Use browser developer tools to simulate different mobile screen sizes.
    *   Test on real mobile devices if possible.
2.  **Functional Testing:**
    *   Verify that all existing functionalities (tab switching, memo editing, etc.) work as expected.
    *   Create a checklist of functionalities to test.
3.  **Cross-Browser Testing:**
    *   Test on major mobile browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox).
    *   Use browser compatibility testing tools (BrowserStack, Sauce Labs) if available.
4.  **Performance Testing:**
    *   Use browser developer tools to measure page load time and rendering performance.
    *   Ensure that the changes do not significantly degrade performance.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the UI is responsive, all existing functionalities work correctly, the UI is compatible across different mobile browsers, and the performance impact is minimal.

subtasks.title: Plan and Document the Testing Process
subtasks.description: Define the scope, objectives, and methodologies for all testing types (responsive, functional, cross-browser, performance). Document the testing environment, tools, and data used.
subtasks.details: Create a detailed test plan document outlining the testing strategy, schedule, and resource allocation.

subtasks.title: Conduct Responsive Testing
subtasks.description: Test the application's responsiveness across various screen sizes and devices (desktops, tablets, mobile phones).
subtasks.details: Use browser developer tools and real devices to verify the layout, content, and functionality adapt correctly to different screen resolutions and orientations.

subtasks.title: Perform Functional Testing with Checklist
subtasks.description: Execute functional tests based on a predefined checklist to verify that all features and functionalities work as expected.
subtasks.details: Create a functional test checklist covering all user stories and requirements. Execute each test case and record the results.

subtasks.title: Execute Cross-Browser Testing
subtasks.description: Test the application's compatibility and functionality across different web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).
subtasks.details: Use browser compatibility testing tools and manual testing to ensure the application renders and functions correctly in each browser.

subtasks.title: Conduct Performance Testing
subtasks.description: Evaluate the application's performance characteristics, including load time, response time, and scalability.
subtasks.details: Use performance testing tools to simulate user load and measure key performance metrics. Identify and address any performance bottlenecks.

subtasks.title: Create Bug Reports
subtasks.description: Document any issues or defects found during testing in a clear and concise bug report.
subtasks.details: Create detailed bug reports for each identified issue, including steps to reproduce, expected results, and actual results. Assign severity and priority to each bug.

tasks.title: Resolve CSS Priority Conflicts
tasks.description: Address any CSS priority conflicts between existing styles and new mobile styles. Ensure that the responsive prefixes are correctly applied and that the styles are not overridden by other styles. Avoid using `!important` to maintain CSS specificity.
tasks.details:
1.  **Inspect CSS:**
    *   Use browser developer tools to inspect the CSS rules applied to the elements.
    *   Identify any conflicting styles.
2.  **Adjust Specificity:**
    *   Increase the specificity of the mobile styles by adding more specific selectors.
    *   Ensure that the responsive prefixes are correctly applied.
3.  **Avoid `!important`:**
    *   Avoid using `!important` to override styles, as it can make the CSS harder to maintain.
4.  **Testing:**
    *   Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly.
    *   Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that there are no CSS priority conflicts and that the styles are applied correctly on mobile devices. Ensure that the desktop view is unaffected.

tasks.title: Ensure Correct Responsive Breakpoint Application
tasks.description: Ensure that the responsive breakpoints are correctly applied and that the styles are applied to the correct screen sizes. Avoid confusion between `sm:`, `md:`, and `lg:` breakpoints by accurately referencing Tailwind documentation and testing on different screen sizes.
tasks.details:
1.  **Verify Breakpoints:**
    *   Use browser developer tools to verify that the responsive breakpoints are correctly applied.
    *   Test on different screen sizes to ensure that the styles are applied to the correct devices.
2.  **Tailwind Documentation:**
    *   Refer to the Tailwind CSS documentation to understand the different breakpoint values.
3.  **Testing:**
    *   Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly.
    *   Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the responsive breakpoints are correctly applied and that the styles are applied to the correct screen sizes. Ensure that the desktop view is unaffected.

tasks.title: Prevent Unintended Changes to Memo Card Design
tasks.description: Ensure that the `TSNoteCard` component is not modified and that the changes only affect the parent container. Avoid unintended changes to the memo card design by only modifying the parent container's styles.
tasks.details:
1.  **Avoid Modifying `TSNoteCard`:**
    *   Do not modify the `TSNoteCard.tsx` file.
    *   Only modify the parent container's styles.
2.  **Verify Design:**
    *   Verify that the memo card design remains unchanged.
3.  **Testing:**
    *   Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly.
    *   Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the memo card design remains unchanged and that the styles are applied correctly on mobile devices. Ensure that the desktop view is unaffected.

tasks.title: Prevent Damage to Existing Functionality
tasks.description: Ensure that existing functionalities, such as tab switching and memo editing, are not broken by the changes. Create a checklist of functionalities to test and verify that they work as expected.
tasks.details:
1.  **Create Checklist:**
    *   Create a checklist of existing functionalities to test.
2.  **Functional Testing:**
    *   Test each functionality on the checklist.
    *   Verify that they work as expected.
3.  **Testing:**
    *   Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly.
    *   Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that all existing functionalities work correctly and that the styles are applied correctly on mobile devices. Ensure that the desktop view is unaffected.

tasks.title: Ensure Cross-Browser Compatibility
tasks.description: Ensure that the UI is compatible across different mobile browsers. Test on major mobile browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox) and use safe CSS properties to avoid compatibility issues.
tasks.details:
1.  **Test on Major Browsers:**
    *   Test on Chrome, Safari, and Firefox on mobile devices.
2.  **Use Safe CSS Properties:**
    *   Use CSS properties that are widely supported across different browsers.
3.  **Testing:**
    *   Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly.
    *   Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the UI is compatible across different mobile browsers and that the styles are applied correctly on mobile devices. Ensure that the desktop view is unaffected.

tasks.title: Minimize Performance Impact
tasks.description: Ensure that the changes do not significantly degrade the performance of the page. Minimize the number of new CSS classes and reuse existing classes as much as possible.
tasks.details:
1.  **Minimize New Classes:**
    *   Reuse existing CSS classes as much as possible.
    *   Avoid creating unnecessary new classes.
2.  **Performance Testing:**
    *   Use browser developer tools to measure page load time and rendering performance.
    *   Ensure that the changes do not significantly degrade performance.
3.  **Testing:**
    *   Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure the styles are applied correctly.
    *   Verify that the desktop view remains unchanged.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the changes do not significantly degrade the performance of the page and that the styles are applied correctly on mobile devices. Ensure that the desktop view is unaffected.
